page.title: 03PEOPLE No.1 (LAMPHEY)
page.content: William Gooch is a young man who lives with his parents on a farm near Hodgeston.He attends school in Pembroke and is studying for his A levels.He does not like living in the area as he feels there is little stimulation for a boy of his age in the rural environment.Although he agrees that there are some basic facilities such as a playng field and open spaces,a social club and more elaborate sports facilities are really required in the village.For any social activities he has to travel to Pembroke either by bus or train,both of which operate limited services.His aspirations are to obtain a secure job with a decent salary,to marry and to have children.He realises that decent employment will require a move to a more built up area
